intro: Pilosella pachylodes, commonly known as the woolly pincushion, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It is characterized by its dense, white, woolly foliage that covers its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spherical clusters, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Pilosella pachylodes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique texture and aesthetic appeal.
